questions.question: What is MOST important according to the Agile Manifesto?

answers.answer: Documentation and planning
People and how they communicate
Control and management
Processes and tools

questions.question: Agile Manifesto says to value responding to change over following a plan. Which of the following statements illustrates this?

answers.answer: Changes are accepted up until the point that the first Sprint begins. Then, changes are deferred to a future release
Changes are accepted only if other features are removed from the backlog such that a fixed end-date is maintained.
Changes are accepted up until about halfway through the project, then all changes are deferred to a future release.

Changes are accepted at any time during the development effort depending on the business value of the change, the PO's acceptance, and the ability of the Scrum Team to respond in a timeframe acceptable to the PO.

questions.question: What emerges from a self organized team?

answers.answer: The best architecture, requirements and design
The best user stories and requirements
The best process flows, user stories and requirements
All are valid considerations

questions.question: In Agile Manifesto which of the following is stated as value ?

answers.answer: Individuals and interactions over Following a plan
Working software over comprehensive documentation
Customer collaboration over processes and tools
Responding to change over contract negotiation

questions.question: In Agile Manifesto the first principle states that individuals and interactions are _____ processes and tools.

answers.answer: As important as
Little important than
More important than
Less important than
